Today, the mainstream belief among scientists is that race is a social construct  without biological meaning.
The  researchers also acknowledged that there are a few areas where race as a construct might still be useful in scientific  research: as a political and social, but not biological, variable.

And what if Americans become so familiar with having Obama as their president that they stop considering his race altogether?
This might seem like the ultimate defeat for racism, but ignoring the race of certain select individuals—a phenomenon that psychologists call subtyping—also has an insidious (隐伏的) side
The worst possible aspect of the Obama effect is that people could ignore his race altogether and continue to hold on to their old racial stereotypes.

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"民族，种族"之意。
means: nation ： 特指居住于同一区域，有共同历史、语言、文化及心理素质等的人类群体。
people ： 侧重指由有共同文化、社会基础而所形成的人民整体。
race ： 专指有共同祖先和相同肤色、面部特征等遗传特征以及共同风俗等的人群。
run ： 最普通用词，指由于各种原因而急速奔跑。
jog ： 指从容不迫地慢跑。
race ： 多用于赛跑，指以最快速度奔跑。
trot ： 强调小跑时上下弹跳的动作，是介于跑与走之间轻快的快速运动。

word_mean: 人种：人类的分类。狭义而言，指某一民族或某一部落的血统
更狭义而言，指血统家系，即一类谱系相同的人。遗传上，人种指基因频率分布不同的诸群体
属、类：因遗传相同而具有某些共同特征的动物个体

means.word_mean: (速度)比赛, 赛跑; 竞争
经常含某种或某些基因的人群
(事件等的)进行；(日、月等的)运行
和…比速度; （和…）比赛; (使)参加比赛; 让…参加速度比赛

sentences.en: He's a very good swimmer and often races.
sentences.cn: 他是个优秀游泳选手, 经常参加比赛。

sentences.en: Are you going to race your horse at Newmarket next week?
sentences.cn: 你要让你的马参加下周在纽马克特的赛马会吗?

sentences.en: My horse has hurt his toe so I can't race him.
sentences.cn: 我的马伤了脚趾, 我不能骑它比赛。

sentences.en: Some medieval towns raced donkeys or buffaloes.
sentences.cn: 有些中世纪的城市用驴子或水牛竞赛。

sentences.en: I'll race you home.
sentences.cn: 我和你比赛看谁先到家。

sentences.en: The children raced towards me.
sentences.cn: 孩子们飞快地向我跑来。

sentences.en: He raced his car across the desert.
sentences.cn: 他开车驶过那片荒漠。

sentences.en: Let's race to see what is happening.
sentences.cn: 咱们跑去看看发生了什么事情。

means.word_mean: （因为害怕、兴奋等）急速跳动，快速转动

sentences.en: She jumped on her bicycle and raced to the library.
sentences.cn: 她跳上自行车向图书馆飞奔而去。</seg>

jx.jx_en_mean: [usu. with negative](Austral./NZ informal)have a chance of success
jx.jx_cn_mean: (澳/新西兰，非正式)有希望赢；有成功机会

lj.lj_ly: with you dressed up, none of us others will be in the race.
lj.lj_ls: 你这样一打扮，我们谁都没有赢的希望。

jx.jx_en_mean: a situation in which something must be done before a particular point in time

lj.lj_ly: it was a race against time to reach shore before the dinghy sank.
lj.lj_ls: 小舢板必须抢在下沉之前到达岸边。

entry.def: A race is a competition to see who is the fastest, for example in running, swimming, or driving.

example.ex: The women's race was won by the American, Patti Sue Plumer.
example.tran: 女子赛跑的冠军被美国人帕蒂·休·普卢默夺得。

entry.def: If you race, you take part in a race.

example.ex: In the 10 years I raced in Europe, 30 drivers were killed...
example.tran: 在我10年的欧洲赛车生涯中，有30名车手丧生。

example.ex: They may even have raced each other — but not regularly.
example.tran: 他们甚至可能曾经相互比试过，只不过不是经常性的。

entry.def: The races are a series of horse races that are held in a particular place on a particular day. People go to watch and to bet on which horse will win.

example.ex: The high point of this trip was a day at the races.
example.tran: 此行的高潮是去看赛马会的那一天。

entry.def: A race is a situation in which people or organizations compete with each other for power or control.

example.ex: The race for the White House begins in earnest today...
example.tran: 入主白宫的角逐今天正式开始。

example.ex: The race is on to build up membership fast.
example.tran: 举办这次竞赛是为了迅速招募成员。

entry.def: A race is one of the major groups which human beings can be divided into according to their physical features, such as the colour of their skin.

example.ex: The College welcomes students of all races, faiths, and nationalities...
example.tran: 学院欢迎所有的学生，无论其种族、宗教信仰和国籍是什么。

example.ex: Discrimination by employers on the grounds of race and nationality was illegal.
example.tran: 雇主以种族或国籍为由歧视员工是非法的。

entry.def: If you race somewhere, you go there as quickly as possible.

example.ex: He raced across town to the State House building...
example.tran: 他快速穿过市区赶往州议会大厦。

example.ex: The hares raced away out of sight.
example.tran: 野兔飞奔而去，很快就看不见了。

entry.def: If something races towards a particular state or position, it moves very fast towards that state or position.
entry.tran: （向某种状态或位置）急速发展，快速移动

example.ex: Do they realize we are racing towards complete economic collapse?...
example.tran: 他们意识到我们的经济马上要彻底崩溃了吗？

entry.def: If you race a vehicle or animal, you prepare it for races and make it take part in races.

example.ex: He still raced sports cars as often as he could.
example.tran: 他仍然尽可能经常地参加赛车比赛。

entry.def: If your mind races, or if thoughts race through your mind, you think very fast about something, especially when you are in a difficult or dangerous situation.
entry.tran: （尤指在面临困难或危险时大脑）飞速运转

example.ex: I made sure I sounded calm but my mind was racing...
example.tran: 我确保自己听上去很镇定，但脑筋却飞快地转着。

example.ex: Already her mind was racing ahead to the hundred and one things she had to do...
example.tran: 她的脑子已经急速地转动起来，思考自己必须做的那一大堆事。

entry.def: If your heart races, it beats very quickly because you are excited or afraid.
entry.tran: （心脏因兴奋或害怕）快速搏动，剧烈跳动

example.tran: 她控制不住地心跳加速。

entry.def: You describe a situation as a race against time when you have to work very fast in order to do something before a particular time, or before another thing happens.

example.ex: An air force spokesman said the rescue operation was a race against time.
example.tran: 一名空军发言人说这次营救行动是在和时间赛跑。

means.word_mean: 2. people who are believed to belong to the same genetic stock;

sentences.sentence: "some biologists doubt that there are important genetic differences between races of human beings"

means.word_mean: 4. the flow of air that is driven backwards by an aircraft propeller
5. (biology) a taxonomic group that is a division of a species; usually arises as a consequence of geographical isolation within a species
6. a canal for a current of water

sentences.sentence: "He rushed down the hall to receive his guests"
"he is running the Marathon this year"
"let's race and see who gets there first"

means.word_mean: 3. to work as fast as possible towards a goal, sometimes in competition with others;

sentences.sentence: "We are racing to find a cure for AIDS"

means.word_mean: 4. cause to move fast or to rush or race;

sentences.sentence: "The psychologist raced the rats through a long maze"

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English, from Old Norse rás 'current'. It was originally a northern English word with the sense 'rapid forward movement', which gave rise to the senses 'contest of speed' (early 16th cent.) and 'channel, path' (i.e. the space traversed). The verb dates from the late 15th cent
early 16th cent. (denoting a group with common features): via French from Italian razza, of unknown ultimate origin
late Middle English: from Old French rais, from Latin radix, radic- 'root'

sentences.en: To prove that he was faster than his friend, John challenged him to a race.

sentences.cn: 跳过障碍在赛跑时或象在赛跑时一样越过 ( 障碍 )
sentences.en: To leap over ( a barrier ) in or as if in a race.

sentences.cn: 他的那次事故葬送了他参加那次赛跑的机会.
sentences.en: His accident has put paid to his chances of taking part in the race.

sentences.cn: 这是和时间赛跑.
sentences.en: It was a race against time.

sentences.cn: 男同学们赢得了接力赛跑,我非常高兴.
sentences.en: I was very glad when the boys won the relay race.

sentences.cn: 野兔和乌龟要赛跑.
sentences.en: The hare and the tortoise are going to have a race!

sentences.cn: 我们急于想听到宣布赛跑优胜者名单.
sentences.en: We were eager to hear the announcement of the winner of the race.

sentences.cn: 和艾滋病赛跑,我们输了 吗 ?
sentences.en: The world is losing the race against AIDS?

sentences.cn: 生活不是一场赛跑, 请慢一点儿.
sentences.en: Life is not a race. Do take It'slower.

sentences.cn: 下次赛跑他就要全力以赴了.
sentences.en: The next race will put him on his mettle.

sentences.cn: 他赛跑时落在后面.
sentences.en: He was left behind in the race.

sentences.cn: 他认为人类进化的特征是他称作“适者生存”的竞争。在这种竞争过程中，较弱的种族和社会最终一定会被更强大、更先进的种族和社会所取代。
sentences.en: He argued that human evolution was characterized by a struggle he called the “survival of the fittest,” in which weaker races and societies must eventually be replaced by stronger, more advanced races and societies.

sentences.cn: 后来，越来越多的老牌公司竞相把这类专利加入自己的案卷之中，希望把它作为防备竞争对手抢占先机的防御措施。
sentences.en: Later，more established companies raced to add such patents to their files, if only as a defensive move against rivals that might beat them to the punch.

sentences.cn: 路跑并非一种竟技项目,而是计时赛:你唯一的竞争者是计时器。
sentences.en: Parkrun is not a race but g time trial: Your only competitor is the clock.

sentences.cn: 他与十个人竞争, 所以他确实跑得不错,才赢得了这场赛跑.
sentences.en: He was in competition with 10 others, so he did well to win the race.

sentences.cn: 你始终都在和由你的对手掌控的其它文化群落进行殊死竞争.
sentences.en: All the while you are racing against other cultures being tweaked by your opponent.

sentences.cn: 费尔南多-阿隆索: 在最初的比赛中看到了赛车的竞争力之后, 我很有信心.
sentences.en: FA: After these first races, seeing the competitiveness of the car, I am very confident.

sentences.cn: 你在这件事上的冷漠态度会让你在这次竞争中失分的.
sentences.en: Your cool attitude on this event will lose you points in the race.

sentences.cn: 但是选举结果由少数几个具有竞争力的州(的选票)来决定.
sentences.en: But the race could be decided hand full a handful of highly contested states.

sentences.cn: 在当今竞争激烈的世界里, 惟有适者才能生存.
sentences.en: In the rat race of today's world, only the fittest survives.

sentences.cn: 奥巴马政府正在执行一项“力争上游”的全国性竞争.
sentences.en: The Obama administration is lunching launching a national competion competition called Race to the Top.

sentences.cn: 超级大国之间正在加紧军备竞争.
sentences.en: The arms race among the superpowers is being stepped up without cease.

sentences.cn: 旅游是一个伟大的方式来逃避你死我活的竞争和新的文化和经验的地方.
sentences.en: Bird Watching is a great way to escape the rat race and be one with nature.

sentences.cn: 这次比赛激发了他的竞争意识.
sentences.en: The race provoked his spirit of competition.

sentences.cn: 当电路按基本方式工作时,必须没有临界竞争存在.
sentences.en: There must be no critical races when the circuit is operated in fundamental mode.

sentences.cn: 女人在oycling中竞争, 竞赛轮子 - 到 - 在竞争上的轮子和没有刹车的脚踏车.
sentences.en: The women compete in the oycling, racing wheel - to - wheel on competition bike with no brakes.

sentences.cn: 本领练好了, 竞争就比较容易了.
sentences.en: When that is done, the race will be found comparatively easy.

sentences.cn: 今年(美国)的众议员竞选,在435个议席当中有竞争气氛(意谓不是一边倒)的只有几十个而矣.
sentences.en: Only a couple of dozen of this year's 435 US House races are competitive.

sentences.cn: 迈克拉伦在这里似乎不像在前几站那么有竞争力.
sentences.en: It appears the McLaren Mercedes challenge here has not been quite the as in other races.

sentences.cn: 我们足敢说,世界冠军的竞争会随着每场比赛的进行变得越来越精彩.
sentences.en: Suffice it to say that the world championship fight gets better with every race.

sentences.cn: 这个冠军没有真正的竞争对手,比赛谁是胜家早为人知.
sentences.en: The champion has no real competition and the contest has turned into a one - horse race.

sentences.cn: 他决定退出商业竞争而去买一个小农场.
sentences.en: He decide to get out of the rat race and buy a small farm.

sentences.cn: 他们渴望能够摆脱无情的竞争,搬到乡下去.

sentences.en: Paul got caught up in the rat race and was never at home.

sentences.en: Use of this circuit property may eliminate undesirable race condition.

sentences.en: The space race reached its culmination in the first moon walk.

sentences.en: Arsenal aren't out of title race but it was a big blow to them.

sentences.cn: 在更多投手的质和量的补强竞争是永远不会停止的.
sentences.en: The race for more pitching in quantity and quality never stops.

sentences.cn: 争,只能“为善竞争”, “与时日竞争”.
sentences.en: Compete only for good Race against time , fight for every second.

sentences.cn: 父亲想离开无休无止的竞争,回到他的故乡.
sentences.en: Dad wants to get out of the rat race and move back to his hometown.

sentences.en: For each primary site , TNM staging was imputed, and staging distributions were compared between races.

sentences.en: Most people belong to the three main races.

sentences.en: At certain times I have no race, I am me.

sentences.en: Some biologists doubt that there are important genetic differences between races of human beings.

sentences.en: Race, ethnicity, and nationality must be acknowledged as pervasive and potent.

Sentence.sentence: He estimated that the comfort level will increase considerably in five to ten years3) One dog has been killed and multiple dogs have been injured by a snowmobile driver in what appears to be an intentional attack on competitors in the Iditarod Race in Alaska.
Although this incident very much alters the race of the two participants competing for a win, both are going to continue on their way toward the finish line.
Several recent studies have found that being randomly (随机地) assigned to a roommate of another race can lead to increased tolerance but also to a greater likelihood (可能性)of conflict.
Recent reports found that lodging with a student of a different race may decrease prejudice and compel students to engage in more ethnically diverse friendships
At Penn, students are not asked to indicate race when applying for housing.
The RA said that these conflicts have also occurred among roommates of the same race
The school randomly assigns roommates without regard to race
According to two recent studies, randomly assigned roommates of different races are more likely to experience conflicts so strained that one roommate will move out.
Conflicts between students of different races are unavoidable
Students of different races are prejudiced against each other.
Roommates of different races just don't get along
Students of different races are required to share a room.
Lodging is assigned to students of different races without exception
It is easy to accept that genes control physical characteristics such as sex, race and eye color.
Well, I always loved racing bikes and fixing them.
Imagine a world where building the tallest skyscraper wasn't a race of height, but rather one to collect the most solar energy.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月四级真题（第三套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: One dog has been killed and multiple dogs have been injured by a snowmobile driver in what appears to be an intentional attack on competitors in the Iditarod Race in Alaska.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月四级真题（第一套）听力 Section A
